value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Dual Y Axis Chart

This chart was made using https://charts.powerbi.tips  Blog Post: https://powerbi.tips/2019/09/dual-y-axis-line-chart/ Visit PowerBI.Tips: https://powerbi.tips/  Source files for this project are located here on GitHub:  https://github.com/MikeCarlo/PowerBI-Dual-y-axis-Line-Chart

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group

value.excerpt: Power BI dashboard and reports come with a usage metric, which you can see how users used this content. value.title: Create Row Number for Each Group in Power BI using Power Query

value.title: Exception Reporting in Power BI Catch the Error Rows in Power Query
value.excerpt: To build a robust BI system, you need to cater for errors and handle errors carefully. If you build a reporting solution that the refresh of that fails everytime an error occurs, it is not a robust system. Errors can happen by many reasons, In this video, I’ll show you a way to catch potential errors

value.title: Export the Data of a Power BI table entirely in a few Clicks
value.excerpt: If you want to export the data of a Power BI table, you have options such as copy and paste, or putting it in a visual and export it. However, there is an easier way available too. value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. value.title: Previous Dynamic Period using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year.
